meanings.sent1: He had to rebore the hole to make it bigger.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to rebore the engine cylinder for better performance.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter accidentally rebored the wrong side of the wood, creating a unique design.
meanings.sent4: Her words rebored into his heart, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The drill bit eagerly rebored through the tough metal, showing its strength.

meanings.definition: A hole made by boring again.
meanings.sent1: The rebore in the wall allowed for better ventilation.
meanings.sent2: The engine block needed a rebore to fix the damage.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rebore in the ground turned out to be a hidden treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: The rebore in the tree trunk served as a cozy home for a family of squirrels.
meanings.sent5: The deep rebore in the rock formation revealed a hidden cave system.
